stem: A 55 year old patient presented with painless bright red blood passage with stools. Examination revealed external haemorrhoids. What is the next step in management?
opt3: Reassure and ask him to visit after 6 months
disc:
A proper history and a physical examination is essential to diagnose hemorrhoids. PE includes a digital rectal examination and anoscopy. 

Treatment depends on the type and severity of the haemorrhoids.
